intro: Sherbournia ailarama, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Gesneriaceae and is characterized by its velvety, waxy leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows as a herbaceous perennial, often forming a compact rosette structure. Its flowers come in a variety of colors, including shades of purple, pink, and white, and are pollinated primarily by insects. Sherbournia ailarama is popular as a houseplant due to its ornamental value and relatively easy care requirements.
